data.text:
Nia Long is an American film and television actress. With an electric smile that can brighten up an entire town, Nia Long has gone on to star in numerous movies and TV series throughout her long career in Hollywood.

She is known for her roles in the classic 90s show The Prince of Bel Air and the crime series Third Watch. She also had notable roles in comedy films such as Friday, The Best Man, the Mom’s Big House franchise and Are We There Yet? opposing ice cube. Nia Long is a three-time NAACP Image Award winner and also received another nomination for her performance in the hit series The House of Lies.

Nia Long Bio, Age

She was born Nia Talita Long on October 30, 1970 in Brooklyn, New York. His mother Talita Long (née Gillman) was an art teacher. His father, Doughtry Long, was both a teacher and a poet.

Her parents divorced when she was only two years old. Her mother, who was then a master’s candidate at the University of Iowa, moved to Iowa City, taking Nia with her. They then moved to South Central Los Angeles. Nia Long completed high school at Westchester High School in Los Angeles and graduated in 1989. In addition to her studies, she also enrolled in ballet, jazz, guitar, gymnastics and of course an actress.

A few years after leaving high school, Nia Long made her big-screen debut in John Singleton’s first film Boyz N the Hood (1991), which was filmed near her home. Boyz N the Hood is also credited with launching the career of other Hollywood films such as Morris Chestnut, Ice Cube, Cuba Gooding Jr. and the film also earned director John Singleton an Oscar nomination at age 23.

However, Long got her big break in 1991 when she joined the cast of the daytime soap Guiding Light, on a three-year deal as Kathryn “Kat” Speake. On the show, Long was able to learn the basics of acting. In 1994, she landed a bigger role in the comedy series The Fresh Prince of Bel Air, playing Will Smith’s girlfriend. She was cast in the role by series star Will Smith.

Throughout the 90s and into the turn of the century, Nia Long remained consistent and relevant, taking on comedic roles that touched different genres and audiences. Long starred in the 1997 cult classic Love Jones, Food Soul (1997) and the acclaimed 1999 romantic comedy The Best Man. Her role in Mom’s Big House (2000) earned her a nomination for the 2001 NAACP Image Award for Outstanding Actress in a Motion Picture, as well as a Blockbuster Entertainment Award for Best Actress in a Comedy.

In addition to her film successes, Nia Long has also recorded many small screen roles, including Judging Amy (2001-2002), Third Watch (2003-05), Boston Legal (2007) and House of Lies (2008). In 2017, the talented actress landed a role in the crime drama series NCIS: Los Angeles.

Nia Long is currently in her late 40s despite looking no older than 30.

Who is Nia Long’s husband? Kids

According to media reports, Nia Long is not married. However, she is engaged to her longtime boyfriend, Ime Sunday Udoka, who is a former player turned NBA coach. Ime Udoka joined the San Antonio Spurs in 2012 as an assistant coach.

The relationship between the two dates back to 2010. A year later, they welcomed their first child, a son named Kez Sunday Udoka. They got engaged in May 2015.

Ime Udoka was born on August 9, 1977 to a Nigerian father and an American mother. Her father is from Akwa Ibom State, Nigeria while her mother was from Illinois. His sister, Mfon Udoka, played for the WNBA and internationally for the Nigerian women’s basketball team.

During his NBA career, Ime Udoka played for the LA Lakers, New York Knicks, Portland Trail Blazers, and Sacramento Kings. He played at international level for the Nigeria national basketball team and represented the country in championships such as the 2005 African Championships, 2006 FIBA ​​World Championships and 2011 African Championships.

Nia Long has two children. Her first son, Massai Zhivago Dorsey II, was born on November 26, 2000. He gave birth to him for a long time while she was with actor Massai Dorsey. On November 7, 2011, Nia Long welcomed her second child, Kez Sunday Udoka, with her fiancé Ime Sunday Udoka.

Net value

For several decades, Nia Long has been wowing audiences with epic performances in various film genres. Indeed, she is a household name in Hollywood and has managed to maintain her relevance over the years. So it’s no surprise that his net worth is currently estimated at $13 million.

Much of her wealth has been gained through her illustrious career in acting, she has also signed a number of contracts with brands such as Dark and Lovely and White Diamonds Luster Fragrance.

Other Facts About Nia Long

In 1982, Nia Long had her first role in an uncredited role in the television series. Silver Spoons (1982).

Nia Long is the younger half-sister of comedian and actress Sommore (born Lori Ann Rambough).

The gorgeous actress was voted one of the 50 Most Beautiful People in the World in 2000 by People Magazine.

Nia Long rejected the role of Alex Munday in the 2001 action comedy Charlie’s Angels, the role was eventually played by Lucy Liu.

The beautiful actress was featured on the video for Ashanti’s 2001 single “ Baby ” which she also co-directed.

Nia Long was due to marry her baby daddy Massai Z. Dorsey in June 2001. However, their relationship ended before they could walk down the aisle.

Nia Long received two consecutive NAACP Image Awards for her role in Third Watch (2004 and 2005).
